meanings.definition: Cranches (verb): to break with a cracking sound
meanings.sent1: She cranches the cookie in half to share with her friend.
meanings.sent2: The dry leaves cranches under our feet as we walk through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The old wooden floorboards cranches loudly every time someone steps on them.
meanings.sent4: His heart cranches into a million pieces when he hears the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The ice cranches beneath their weight as they skate across the frozen pond.

meanings.definition: Cranches (noun): small pieces of broken food or other material
meanings.sent1: She picked up the cranches of glass from the shattered vase.
meanings.sent2: The birds pecked at the cranches of bread left on the park bench.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled the cranches of nuts on top of the dessert for added crunch.
meanings.sent4: The cranches of paper littered the classroom floor after the art project.
meanings.sent5: The child carefully collected the cranches of seashells along the shore.
